books.description: An examination of the leadership of the prime minister Winston Churchill. Read by John Lee and the author. 17 hours and 49 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE SPLENDID AND THE VILE

books.author: Tom O'Neill and Dan Piepenbring
books.contributor: by Tom O'Neill and Dan Piepenbring
books.description: A reassessment of events surrounding the murders committed by Charles Manson’s followers. Read by Kevin Stillwell. 16 hours, 15 minutes unabridged.
books.title: CHAOS

books.author: Robert Kolker
books.description: From 1945 to 1965, a family in Colorado had 12 children, six of whom went on to develop schizophrenia. Read by Sean Pratt. 13 hours, 8 minutes unabridged.
books.title: HIDDEN VALLEY ROAD

books.author: Stephen Fry
books.description: Whimsical retelling of Greek myths. Read by the author. 15 hours, 26 minutes unabridged.
books.title: MYTHOS

books.author: Tara Westover
books.description: The daughter of survivalists, who is kept out of school, educates herself enough to leave home for university. Read by Julia Whelan. 12 hours, 10 minutes unabridged.
books.title: EDUCATED

books.author: Yuval Noah Harari
books.description: How Homo sapiens became Earth’s dominant species. Read by Derek Perkins. 15 hours, 17 minutes unabridged.
books.title: SAPIENS

books.author: John M. Barry
books.description: An overview of the 1918 flu epidemic and cautionary tale for similar kinds of large-scale outbreaks. Read by Scott Brick. 19 hours, 26 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE GREAT INFLUENZA

books.author: Jessica Simpson with Kevin Carr O’Leary
books.contributor: by Jessica Simpson with Kevin Carr O’Leary
books.description: The singer, actress and fashion designer discloses times of success, trauma and addiction. Read by Jessica Simpson. 11 hours, 22 minutes unabridged.
books.title: OPEN BOOK

books.author: Trevor Noah
books.description: A memoir about growing up in South Africa by the host of “The Daily Show.” Read by the author. 8 hours, 50 minutes unabridged.
books.title: BORN A CRIME

books.author: Deborah Feldman
books.description: A woman breaks free of the Satmar Hasidic community in Brooklyn in which she was raised. Read by Rachel Botchan and Cassandra Campbell. 10 hours, 39 minutes unabridged.
books.title: UNORTHODOX

books.author: Marie Kondo and Scott Sonenshein
books.contributor: by Marie Kondo and Scott Sonenshein
books.title: JOY AT WORK

books.contributor: by Jocko Willink and Leif Babin
books.title: EXTREME OWNERSHIP

books.description: Raina finds her tummy trouble might be more than it first appears to be when she goes back to school.

books.description: Shannon struggles to keep up with what is considered cool.
books.title: BEST FRIENDS

books.author: Raina Telgemeier
books.description: Callie becomes the stage manager for her middle school’s production of "Moon Over Mississippi."
books.title: DRAMA

books.author: Jerry Craft
books.description: Jordan Banks, an artistically inclined seventh grader from Washington Heights, has a tough time navigating an upscale private school where diversity is low and maintaining his neighborhood friendships.

books.contributor: by Ann M. Martin. Illustrated by Katy Farina

books.description: Two sisters discover that their quiet coastal town is haunted.

books.description: Moments from the life cycle of a planet’s inhabitants including “Being Gains a Sibling” and “Being Begins a Vocation.”

books.title: CAMP

books.description: The super spy alligators Mango and Brash are awash in crimes to investigate.

books.description: In a world full of people who can develop superpowers, Izuku Midoriya is just a “normal” teenager. Will a chance encounter with a superhero change his fate?
books.title: MY HERO ACADEMIA, VOL. 2

books.description: An artist with a mysterious past and a disregard for the status quo upends a quiet town outside Cleveland.
books.title: LITTLE FIRES EVERYWHERE

books.author: Danielle Steel
books.description: After an accident at her Manhattan home and studio while sorting through some mementos, a photographer embarks on a road trip to reconnect with three men she might have married.
